item.title: Report E-2025050490
item.description:
Report E-2025050490

Identified by scraper @ 2025-06-10T03:46:53+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-05-13
  • City: DES MOINES
  • State: IA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO ENTERPRISE SERVICES, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: At 0221ET, XPO notified ERTS of a cargo release at terminal XDM. It was reported that approximately 1-gallon of "Trufuel" released from a metal can due to a forklift puncture. The release impacted inside of concrete dock floor. ERTS reviewed the SDS with the caller and determined that terminal personnel are capable of cleaning the release with PPE available on site. XPO will place the waste inside of a 35-gallon poly drum. ERTS generated waste ID 237459-1. Chemtrec will be notified.

item.title: Report E-2025050290
item.description:
Report E-2025050290

Identified by scraper @ 2025-06-10T03:46:53+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-05-13
  • City: DES MOINES
  • State: IA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R & L CARRIERS, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 5000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On May 13, 2025, one (1) 55-gallon drum of UN3098 was punctured and released approximately ten (10) gallons of product to the trailer, freight, and terminal asphalt lot. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from EnviroServe (ES) to remediate the site. The crew containerized the damaged drum in one (1) 85-gallon metal overpack and utilized absorbents and hand tools to remediate the impacted areas. All impacted materials were containerized in one (1) 55-gallon drum for disposal. On May 16, 2025, the crew returned to the site due to the chemical eating away at the overpack previously used. ES personnel placed the damaged drum of product into one (1) new 95-gallon poly drum. The old 85-gallon overpack was taken for disposal.

item.title: Report E-2025050025
item.description:
Report E-2025050025

Identified by scraper @ 2025-06-10T03:46:53+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-04-02
  • City: SHELBY
  • State: IA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: At 2104 ET, XPO notified ERTS of a cargo release at terminal XCF. It was reported that approximately 1-teaspoon of "METHYL ETHYL KETONE" released from (2) metal drums due to the lids coming loose on the drums. The release impacted concrete dock floor. ERTS reviewed the SDS with the caller and determined that terminal personnel are capable of cleaning the release with PPE available on site. The drums will be resealed and shipped on. XPO will place the waste inside of a 5-gallon poly drum. ERTS generated waste ID 232660-1
